ParentCompanyName: El Paso Water Utilities-Public Service Board

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
The El Paso Water Utilities - Public Service Board (EPWU-PSB) has prepared this Risk Management Plan (RMP) for the chlorination process at the Pebble Hills Booster Station, in compliance with 40 CFR 68.

The main objectives of this RMP are to: 

A?Communicate the extent of a possible chlorine release and identify possible receptors (Hazard Assessment).

The Hazard Assessment communicates the possible extent of a worst case release and an alternative A?more likelyA? release. The Hazard Assessment also identifies potential public and environmental receptors that may be affected in the event of a chlorine release.

A?Develop strategies to prevent an accidental release (Prevention Program), 

The goal of the Prevention Program is to integrate technologies, procedures, and management practices to minimize the probability of an accidental chlorine release. The Prevention Program incorporates safety information, hazard review, operating procedures, training, maintenance, compliance audits, and incident investigations.

A?Formulate contingency planning in the case of an accidental release (Emergency Response Program).

The Emergency Response Program is modeled after the EPWU-PSBA?s A?Emergency Response Action PlanA? and the Chlorine InstituteA?s A?Emergency Response Plans for Chlorine Facilities.A? The Emergency Response Program incorporates an emergency response plan, emergency response equipment procedures, training in relevant procedures for employees involved in the chlorination process, and procedures to review and update, as appropriate, the emergency response plan to reflect changes and ensure that employees are informed of changes.

The EPWU-PSB plans to review and revise, as necessary, the chlorination process operating procedures in order to make certain that the operators understand the human factors that may lead to accidental releases.
